009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import ij.IJ;
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
022import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
023import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
024import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.Contour;
026import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RegionContourSegmentation;
027
028/**
029 * <p>
030 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the class
031 * {@link RegionContourSegmentation} to perform both region labeling and contour
032 * tracing simultaneously. See Sec. 8.2.2 of [1] for additional details.
033 * Requires a binary image. Zero-value pixels are considered background, all
034 * other pixels are foreground. 
035 * The resulting contours are displayed as a
036 * non-destructive vector overlay on the original image.
037 * Outer contours of single-pixel regions are marked by an "X".
038 * </p>
039 * <p>
040 * Note that (different to ImageJ's built-in morphological operators) this
041 * implementation does not incorporate the current display lookup-table (LUT).
042 * </p>
043 * <p> 
044 * This plugin also demonstrates the use of the {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter} 
045 * (provided by the imagingbook library) which handles 0.5 pixel offsets 
046 * for vector graphics transparently.
047 * </p>
048 * <p>
049 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
050 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
051 * </p>
052 * 
053 * @author WB
054 * @version 2020/12/20
055 * @version 2022/09/27 revised overlay generation
056 * 
057 * @see RegionContourSegmentation
058 */
059public class Region_Contours_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
060        
061        /** Neighborhood type used for region segmentation (4- or 8-neighborhood). */
062        public static NeighborhoodType2D Neighborhood = NeighborhoodType2D.N8;
063        
064        /** Stroke width used for drawing contours. */
065        public static double ContourStrokeWidth = 0.25;
066        /** Color used for drawing outer contours. */
067        public static Color OuterContourColor = Color.red;
068        /** Color used for drawing inner contours. */
069        public static Color InnerContourColor = Color.green;
070        
071        /** Set true to list detected regions to the text console. */
072        public static boolean ListRegions = false;
073        
074        private ImagePlus im = null;
075        
076        @Override
077        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
078                this.im = im;
079                return DOES_8G; 
080        }
081        
082        @Override
083        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
084                
085                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
086                                IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
087                                return;
088                }
089                
090                if (!runDialog())
091                return;
092                
093                // Make sure we have a proper byte image:
094                ByteProcessor bp = ip.convertToByteProcessor();
095                
096                // Create the region segmenter / contour tracer:
097                RegionContourSegmentation seg = new RegionContourSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood);
098                
099                // Get a list of detected regions (sorted by size):
100                List<BinaryRegion> regions = seg.getRegions(true);
101                if (regions.isEmpty()) {
102                        IJ.showMessage("No regions detected!");
103                        return;
104                }
105
106                // Draw outer and inner contours for each detected region:
107                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
108                ColoredStroke outerStroke = new ColoredStroke(ContourStrokeWidth, OuterContourColor);
109                ColoredStroke innerStroke = new ColoredStroke(ContourStrokeWidth, InnerContourColor);
110                
111                for (BinaryRegion r : seg.getRegions()) {
112                        Contour oc = r.getOuterContour();
113                        ola.addShape(oc.getPolygonPath(), outerStroke);
114                        for (Contour ic : r.getInnerContours()) {
115                                ola.addShape(ic.getPolygonPath(), innerStroke);
116                        }
117                }
118                
119                im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
120                
121                // Optionally list regions to console:
122                if (ListRegions) {
123                        IJ.log("\nDetected regions: " + regions.size());
124                        for (BinaryRegion R : regions) {
125                                IJ.log(R.toString());
126                        }
127                }
128                
129        }
130        
131        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
132        
133        private boolean runDialog() {
134                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(Region_Contours_Demo.class.getSimpleName());
135                gd.addEnumChoice("Neighborhood type", Neighborhood);
136                gd.addCheckbox("List regions", ListRegions);
137                
138                gd.showDialog();
139                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
140                        return false;
141                }
142                
143                Neighborhood = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NeighborhoodType2D.class);
144                ListRegions  = gd.getNextBoolean();
145                return true;
146        }
147}
